page.title: 09KIRKNEWTON EDUCATION (1)
page.content: { Kirknewton Church of England Aided {First School}was built in 1964 for 25 pupils.The former school building is now the village hall.There are 12 pupils from 4_9 years. It is staffed by a headteacher,a part_time infant teacher,a part_time secretary,a cleaner and a cook/nanny. It has two classrooms,which can be converted into one large room by means of a sliding screen.The school has a large,grassed playing field and its own computer. At present,{Northumberland County {Council}is reviewing the school's future because of the current small roll. The children are brought to school from the outlying farms by contract hire cars.
